extendedIngredients.name: english cucumber
extendedIngredients.original: 2 cups cucumber, diced (I prefer using 3 or 4 Persian/Pickling cukes because they have fewer seeds and less water, but you can use 1 English Cucumber, instead.)

extendedIngredients.name: raspberry vinegar
extendedIngredients.original: 2 T Raspberry Vinegar (you can also use White Balsamic or Rice Vinegar, but Raspberry is best)

title: Grilled Salmon Salad With Cucumbers, Celery And Capers
summary: Grilled Salmon Salad With Cucumbers, Celery And Capers is a caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal main course. This recipe makes 1 servings with 754 calories, 90g of protein, and 28g of fat each. For $17.77 per serving, this recipe covers 62% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. Head to the store and pick up small-diced onion, raspberry vinegar, cucumber, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the raspberry vinegar you could follow this main course with the Chocolate Banana Tofu Mousse/Dessert as a dessert. The Fourth Of July will be even more special with this recipe. Only a few people made this recipe, and 2 would say it hit the spot. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 45 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 88%. This score is awesome. Try Grilled Salmon and Cucumbers, Quick Celery Root Salad With Capers And Lemon, and Grilled Salmon With Chive and Dill Sauce and Cucumbers for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Salmon on the menu? Try pairing with Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc. To decide on white or red, you should consider your seasoning and sauces. Chardonnay is a great friend to buttery, creamy dishes, while sauvignon blanc can complement herb or citrus-centric dishes. A light-bodied, low-tannin red such as the pinot noir goes great with broiled or grilled salmon. One wine you could try is GEN5 Chardonnay. It has 4.3 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 9 dollars.

productMatches.title: GEN5 Chardonnay
productMatches.description:
A very friendly Chardonnay, with juicy tropical fruit flavors, a hint of creaminess, and a long, bright finish. For five generations our family has lived and worked our land in Lodi, California, always striving to leave the land in a better state for the next
generation.
